page.title: 09Interview:a local resident
page.content: There are nine bedrooms in Castle Hill. The main living rooms are the drawing room, her own sitting rooms and the dining room which isn't used much. Mrs. Methan, Mr. Partridge and Emma who is in the office and herself live in the mansion now. When she married she lived in Newmarket and came down to Filleigh a lot. Her ancestores designed the gardens and planted the trees on the estate. Lady Margaret likes camelias because of the acid soil. The Triumphal arch was built by her ancestors 200 years ago to be part of the landscape. When she was young there were lots of horse and carts. They had a boys school up at the mansion during the war because most schools had been evacuated.
